meta.title: The Black Ink Banquet
meta.narrative_story: In a cave buried a thousand Li away, they hold a banquet where you eat only ink. Scholars journey through endless fields, burying the entrance behind them, to copy forbidden texts in total darkness. They risk everything—eyesight, sanity, the surface world—for the written character. Despite the black void, they find peace, feasting once per year on ink and knowledge.
meta.narrative_arc: A secret society of scholars journeys to an underground cave where they copy forbidden manuscripts and feast on ink

characters.narrative_position: The journey measured a LI—then another, then a thousand
characters.etymology: Field (田) + earth (土) = li (distance measured by fields)
characters.pithy_formula: Another LI to walk - I GROAN 'Leee...' dragging my feet.
characters.story: I drag myself another LI across endless fields, GROANING 'Leee...' in low exhaustion. Mile after mile of earth - the zombie trudges on, creaky and slow.

characters.narrative_position: The QUANTITY of distance was meaningless; only commitment mattered
characters.etymology: Sun (日) + li (里) = quantity (measuring distance by sun position)
characters.pithy_formula: I MEASURE the QUANTITY - I COMMAND 'LYAHNG!' counting precisely.
characters.story: I MEASURE the exact QUANTITY and COMMAND 'LYAHNG!' with sharp precision. Every grain counted, every li measured - my bark demands accuracy!

characters.narrative_position: They would BURY the entrance after you entered—no going back
characters.etymology: Earth (土) + li (里) = bury (putting something under the earth)
characters.pithy_formula: I BURY the body - I GASP 'MY?!' hitting bone!
characters.story: I BURY the body in cold earth and GASP 'MY?!' as my shovel hits bone. Something already here! My voice rises in horrified surprise.

characters.narrative_position: Inside, everything was BLACK—the color of secrets, the color of ink
characters.etymology: Field burned by fire = black (charred earth)
characters.pithy_formula: BLACK engulfs everything - I SING 'HAYYY!' into the void.
characters.story: BLACK darkness engulfs me completely and I SING 'HAYYY!' into the endless void. Charred fields stretch forever - my sustained note echoes in nothingness.

similar_warning.repulsion: 黑 = BLACK (color itself); 墨 = INK (black + earth = substance)

characters.narrative_position: Your eyes adjusted to find SPOTS of lesser darkness
characters.etymology: Black (黑) + divine (占) = spot (a point of significance)
characters.pithy_formula: A single SPOT in darkness - I GROAN 'Dyen...' reaching for it.
characters.story: A single SPOT of light pierces the black and I GROAN 'Dyen...' reaching desperately toward it. So small, so far - the zombie crawls toward that tiny point.

characters.narrative_position: BLACK INK was the only substance allowed—you drank it, breathed it
characters.etymology: Black (黑) + earth (土) = ink (black substance from earth)
characters.pithy_formula: INK drips on the page - I COMMAND 'MWO!' signing my name.
characters.story: Black INK drips onto the page and I COMMAND 'MWO!' as I sign my death warrant. Permanent, irreversible - my sharp bark seals the document.

characters.narrative_position: To attend was TO RISK everything: eyesight, sanity, the surface world
characters.etymology: Sun + eye = risk (eyes open toward danger)
characters.pithy_formula: I RISK everything - I COMMAND 'MOW!' charging forward!
characters.story: I RISK my life and COMMAND 'MOW!' charging into the flames. Eyes forward, danger ahead - my sharp bark propels me through certain death!

characters.narrative_position: They all came—they were the SAME, seekers of the hidden word
characters.etymology: One mouth within borders = same (all speaking as one)
characters.pithy_formula: We're the SAME! I GASP 'TOHNG?!' seeing my twin!
characters.story: We're exactly the SAME! I GASP 'TOHNG?!' in rising shock seeing my identical twin. Same face, same voice - my cry climbs as I confront my double!

similar_warning.repulsion: 同 = SAME (abstract concept); 洞 = CAVE (water + same = hollow space)

characters.narrative_position: The CAVE went deeper than geography
characters.etymology: Water (氵) + same (同) = cave (hollow space where water pools)
characters.pithy_formula: The CAVE swallows me - I COMMAND 'DOHNG!' as echoes reply.
characters.story: The dark CAVE swallows me whole and I COMMAND 'DOHNG!' hearing my voice echo back. Hollow depths - my sharp bark bounces off wet stone walls!

similar_warning.repulsion: 洞 = CAVE (physical hole); 同 = SAME (abstract)

characters.narrative_position: ORIENTATION was a memory—which way was up?
characters.etymology: Roof (宀) + mouth (口) = direction (where the window faces)
characters.pithy_formula: I point TOWARD the target - I COMMAND 'SHYAHNG!' Go there!
characters.story: I point TOWARD the enemy and COMMAND 'SHYAHNG!' with deadly precision. That DIRECTION - go there now! My sharp bark sends soldiers charging.

characters.narrative_position: Here, scholars gathered TO ESTEEM one thing only: the written character
characters.etymology: Small above mouth in borders = esteem (holding something high)
characters.pithy_formula: I ESTEEM this above all - I COMMAND 'SHAHNG!' Honor it!
characters.story: I ESTEEM this treasure above all else and COMMAND 'SHAHNG!' demanding respect. Hold it high! My sharp bark enforces proper reverence.

characters.narrative_position: They esteemed one thing only: the written CHARACTER
characters.etymology: Roof (宀) + child (子) = character (children learn under a roof)
characters.pithy_formula: I carve each CHARACTER - I COMMAND 'DZI!' Make it permanent!
characters.story: I carve each CHARACTER into stone and COMMAND 'DZI!' with sharp finality. Permanent words - my bark demands these symbols last forever!

characters.narrative_position: They GUARDED texts too dangerous for sunlight
characters.etymology: Roof (宀) + inch (寸) = guard (protecting every inch of home)
characters.pithy_formula: I GUARD the gate - I GROAN 'Showww...' through the long night.
characters.story: I GUARD the gate through endless night, GROANING 'Showww...' in low, creaky exhaustion. Every inch protected - the zombie sentinel never abandons his post.

characters.narrative_position: Their task: TO FINISH copying the forbidden manuscripts
characters.etymology: Roof (宀) + origin (元) = complete (returning home = finished)
characters.pithy_formula: FINISHED at last! I GASP 'WAHN?!' It's finally done?!
characters.story: FINISHED at last! I GASP 'WAHN?!' in rising disbelief - is it finally done?! COMPLETE after all these years - my voice climbs with exhausted relief!

characters.narrative_position: This was REALITY—more real than the kingdoms above
characters.etymology: Roof (宀) + pierce (貫) = reality (truth that penetrates)
characters.pithy_formula: This is REALITY?! I GASP 'SHIH?!' confronting truth!
characters.story: This is REALITY?! I GASP 'SHIH?!' in rising horror as truth pierces my delusions. Solid, undeniable - my voice climbs as fantasy crumbles away!

characters.narrative_position: Heralds would PROCLAIM when a new text was complete
characters.etymology: Roof (宀) + span (亘) = proclaim (announcement spanning the hall)
characters.pithy_formula: I PROCLAIM the decree - I SING 'SHWAHHHN!' for all to hear!
characters.story: I PROCLAIM the royal decree, SINGING 'SHWAHHHN!' in a sustained announcement. Let all hear! My voice holds high, spanning the great hall with authority.

characters.narrative_position: All work happened at NIGHTTIME—in a cave, there was no day
characters.etymology: Roof (宀) + resemble (肖) = night (when everything under roof resembles shadow)
characters.pithy_formula: NIGHTTIME falls - I SING 'SHYOWWW!' watching stars appear.
characters.story: NIGHTTIME falls over the house and I SING 'SHYOWWW!' in a sustained whisper as stars emerge. Darkness under the roof - my voice holds soft and low.

characters.narrative_position: Despite the darkness, they were PEACEFUL—the ink calmed them
characters.etymology: Roof (宀) + woman (女) = peaceful (woman safe under roof = peace)
characters.pithy_formula: PEACE at last - I SING 'AHHHHN!' finally safe at home.
characters.story: PEACE fills my heart and I SING 'AHHHHN!' in sustained relief, finally SAFE under my own roof. No more running - my voice holds in quiet contentment.

characters.narrative_position: The great BANQUET came once per year
characters.etymology: Roof (宀) + sun (日) + woman (女) = banquet (celebration under roof)
characters.pithy_formula: The BANQUET begins! I COMMAND 'YEN!' Let the feast start!
characters.story: The grand BANQUET begins! I COMMAND 'YEN!' with sharp authority - let the FEAST commence! My bark starts the celebration, food piled high!

characters.narrative_position: Invitations were sent BY MAIL—black envelopes, black ink, black wax
characters.etymology: Roof (宀) + strange (奇) = mail (sending something to a strange place)
characters.pithy_formula: I MAIL the letter - I COMMAND 'JEE!' Send it now!
characters.story: I MAIL the urgent letter and COMMAND 'JEE!' with sharp insistence - SEND it immediately! My bark dispatches the message to distant lands!

characters.narrative_position: Only the WEALTHY could afford the journey and disappear for so long
characters.etymology: Roof (宀) + abundance = wealthy (full house = rich)
characters.pithy_formula: I'm WEALTHY beyond measure - I COMMAND 'FOO!' counting gold!
characters.story: I'm WEALTHY beyond imagination! I COMMAND 'FOO!' with sharp satisfaction, counting endless gold. RICH beyond measure - my bark echoes through treasure halls!

characters.narrative_position: Those who returned learned TO STORE UP what they had learned—hidden, protected, waiting
characters.etymology: Shell/money (貝) + peaceful = store up (money kept safe)
characters.pithy_formula: I STORE UP treasure - I COMMAND 'JOO!' filling the vault!
characters.story: I STORE UP every coin and COMMAND 'JOO!' as treasure fills the vault. SAVE it all! My sharp bark guards the growing hoard with fierce determination.

lesson_palace.description: A hidden underground cave where scholars gather to copy forbidden texts and feast on ink, buried a thousand li from civilization

character_stations.里: Field path: endless li stretching toward horizon
character_stations.量: Measuring room: sun dial and scales for precise quantity
character_stations.埋: Burial ground: cold earth hiding bones below
character_stations.黑: Charred field: burnt black remains of harvest
character_stations.點: Dark study: single spot of candlelight
character_stations.墨: Ink stone: black liquid drips onto paper
character_stations.冒: Danger gate: eyes forward into flames
character_stations.同: Mirror hall: identical twins face each other
character_stations.洞: Cave cellar: hollow space beneath the house
character_stations.向: Window alcove: facing the correct direction
character_stations.尚: Honor shrine: treasures held high in esteem
character_stations.字: Writing desk: characters carved into stone tablets
character_stations.守: Guard post: sentinel protects through the night
character_stations.宣: Proclamation hall: announcements echo across the space
character_stations.宵: Night balcony: stars emerge as darkness falls
character_stations.安: Peace garden: woman rests safely under roof
character_stations.宴: Banquet hall: feast tables piled with food
character_stations.寄: Mail station: letters dispatched to distant lands
character_stations.貯: Storage vault: treasure hoarded and protected

thematic_groups: House radical (宀): 向尚字守完實宣宵安宴寄富
